channel.title: Help with custom titlescreen
channel.description:
yo guys i tryed to add a custom titlescreen for my client, this is my command for it.
[code]aBackground_966 = new Sprite(titleStreamLoader, "titlebox", 0);[/code]
I got 4 errors with that, so i added an void, this is it
[code] private void loadTitleScreen() {[/code]
This is my error
[code]client.java:30: ';' expected private void loadTitleScreen() ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
Help needed! Thanks

item.title: Help with custom titlescreen
item.dc:creator: @Umah Umah
item.description:
@Umah wrote:

No problem… Glad to help

Read full topic

item.title: Help with custom titlescreen
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

Umah:

I could never do this, so what I did (delete that so no errors before you do this) was downloaded Tom’s Cache Editor, extracted with WinRar, OPened “Suite.jar”, “Load Cache…”, open up your client’s cache folder, and hit “ok”, then “View/Edit Image Archives”, click on “title”, “ok”, and select “titlebox”, and “import”, and choose new titlebox, and hit “save archive” when done. I have a tutorial in the Client Hacking section for it, but using the runescape logo, do the same except use the titlebox, not the logo.

Aww awesome!! Thanks! Ill do this now

Read full topic

item.title: Help with custom titlescreen
item.dc:creator: @Umah Umah

@Umah wrote:

I could never do this, so what I did (delete that so no errors before you do this) was downloaded Tom’s Cache Editor, extracted with WinRar, OPened “Suite.jar”, “Load Cache…”, open up your client’s cache folder, and hit “ok”, then “View/Edit Image Archives”, click on “title”, “ok”, and select “titlebox”, and “import”, and choose new titlebox, and hit “save archive” when done. I have a tutorial in the Client Hacking section for it, but using the runescape logo, do the same except use the titlebox, not the logo.
